attempt-a-roguish-feat.name: Attempt a Roguish Feat
attempt-a-roguish-feat.description: When you attempt a roguish feat you are skilled in, say your goal and roll with Finesse. On a hit, you achieve your goal. On a 7-9, mark exhaustion or one risk of your feat (GM’s choice) comes to bear. When you attempt a roguish feat you are NOT skilled in, you are trusting fate.

figure-someone-out.name: Figure Someone Out
figure-someone-out.description: When you try to figure someone out, roll with Charm. On a 10+, hold 3. On a 7-9, hold 1. While interacting with them, spend your hold 1 for 1 to ask their player a question: is your character telling the truth? | what is your character really feeling? | what does your character intend to do? | what does your character wish I’d do? | how could I get your character to _______?

persuade-an-npc.name: Persuade an NPC
persuade-an-npc.description: When you persuade an NPC with promises or threats, roll with Charm. On a 10+, they see things your way, provided you have given them a strong motive or reasonable bribe. On a 7–9,they aren’t sure; the GM will tell you what you need to do to sway them.

read-a-tense-situation.name: Read a Tense Situation
read-a-tense-situation.description: When you read a tense situation, roll with Cunning. On a 7–9, ask 1. On a 10+, ask 3. Take +1 when acting on the answers. what’s my best way out / in / through? | who or what is the biggest threat? | who or what is most vulnerable to me? | what should I be on the lookout for? | who is in control here?

trick-an-npc.name: Trick an NPC
trick-an-npc.description: When you trick an NPC to get what you want, roll with Cunning. On a hit, they take the bait and do what you want. On a 7–9, they can instead choose one: they hesitate; you shake their confidence or weaken their morale. | they stumble; you gain a critical opportunity. | they overreact; take +1 forward against them.

trust-fate.name: Trust Fate
trust-fate.description: When you trust fate to get through trouble, roll with Luck. On a hit you scrape by or barrel through; the GM will tell you what it costs you. On a 10+, fortune favors the bold; your panache also earns you a fleeting opportunity.

wreck-something.name: Wreck Something
wreck-something.description: When you wreck something, roll with Might. On a hit, you seriously break it; it can’t be used again until it’s repaired. On a 7–9, you’re imprecise and dangerous; you cause collateral damage, attract attention, or end up in a bad spot, GM’s choice.

help-or-interfere.name: Help or Interfere
help-or-interfere.description: When you help or interfere with another vagabond, mark exhaustion to add +1 or -2 to their roll (after rolling). Mark exhaustion again to select one of the following: conceal your help or interference | create an opportunity or obstacle.

plead-with-a-PC.name: Plead with a PC
plead-with-a-PC.description: When you plead with a PC to go along with you, they clear 1 exhaustion if they agree to what you’ve proposed. You may use this move only once per session.
